author: pilatesemma
title: Guest from hell, hosts from heaven
text:
What a lovely hotel, charming & personal Decorated like a cross between a beautiful box of French Art Deco chocolates and the drawings in Paddinton Bear (the lift)
Low key entrance and lobby with sofas but no guests sitting around, its not that kind of hotel so if you want bar/lobby hotel action go elsewhere...but if you want a great base for getting around Paris and a quiet low key lobby that allows a discreet straight in and out access to the lifts/rooms when you return from an event/night out...then perfect.
We stayed in a deluxe room and the huge double windows overlooked the opera house and was so nice to throw these open and let in the cool spring air. Comfy big bed & nice bathroom with great bath & shower.
Staff could not have been more helpful and I was a fairly demanding guest. Arrived too early and they allowed us early check in, recommended and booked an English speaking hairdresser for a blowdry (which by the way was fabulous), lent us cables for devices and adaptors, bought us breakfast in bed upon request, allowed late check out due to inability to move as a result of the hangover from hell, bought up headache tablets for afore-mentioned...literally all in their stride without a fuss. Full salute to all staff, I love you for giving me longer to recover.
I have a client that asked for a report on La Maison Favert as her team visit Paris regularly and I have given it the FULL thumbs up.
